org.qcri.rheem.core.plan.rheemplan

Interface OperatorContainer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LoopSubplan, OperatorAlternative.Alternative, Subplan

    public interface OperatorContainer
    This is not an Operator in its own right. However, it contains a set of operators and can redirect to those.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getSlotMapping

        SlotMapping getSlotMapping()
        Provide the SlotMapping that translates between the contained Operators and the containing CompositeOperator as defined by toOperator().
        Returns:
        the above explained SlotMapping

      • getSource

        Operator getSource()
        Enter this container. This container's CompositeOperator needs to be a source.
        Returns:
        the source operator within this container

      • setSource

        void setSource(Operator innerSource)
        Set the source. This container's CompositeOperator needs to be a source itself.
        Parameters:
        innerSource - the source operator within this container

      • isSource

        default boolean isSource()
        Tells whether this instance represents a sink.
        Returns:
        whether this container corresponds to a source

      • followInput

        <T> java.util.Collection<InputSlot<T>> followInput(InputSlot<T> inputSlot)
        Enter the encased plan by following an inputSlot of the encasing CompositeOperator.
        Parameters:
        inputSlot - an InputSlot of the encasing CompositeOperator
        Returns:
        the InputSlots within the encased plan that are connected to the given inputSlot

      • followInputUnchecked

        default java.util.Collection<InputSlot<?>> followInputUnchecked(InputSlot<?> inputSlot)
        See Also:
        followInput(InputSlot)

      • getSink

        Operator getSink()
        Enter this container. This container's CompositeOperator needs to be a sink.
        Returns:
        the sink operator within this subplan

      • setSink

        void setSink(Operator innerSink)
        Set the sink. This container's CompositeOperator needs to be a sink itself.
        Parameters:
        innerSink - the sink operator within this container

      • isSink

        default boolean isSink()
        Returns:
        whether this container corresponds to a sink

      • traceOutput

        <T> OutputSlot<T> traceOutput(OutputSlot<T> outputSlot)
        Enter the encased plan by following an outputSlot of the encasing CompositeOperator.
        Parameters:
        outputSlot - an OutputSlot of the encasing CompositeOperator
        Returns:
        the OutputSlot within the encased plan that are connected to the given outputSlot

      • toOperator

        CompositeOperator toOperator()
        Returns:
        the CompositeOperator that corresponds to this instance, not any of the contained Operators

      • traceInput

        <T> InputSlot<T> traceInput(InputSlot<T> inputSlot)
        Return the InputSlot that represents the given inputSlot. NB: This method assumes the given inputSlot has no occupant (see InputSlot.getOccupant()).
        Parameters:
        inputSlot - the InputSlot of a contained Operator that is to be resolved
        Returns:
        the InputSlot that represents the given inputSlot or null if there is none

      • followOutput

        <T> java.util.Collection<OutputSlot<T>> followOutput(OutputSlot<T> outputSlot)
        Exit the encased plan by following an outputSlot of an encased, terminal Operator.
        Parameters:
        outputSlot - the OutputSlot to follow
        Returns:
        the OutputSlots of the encasing CompositeOperator (see toOperator()) that represent the given outputSlot or null if none

      • propagateInputCardinality

                                       OptimizationContext.OperatorContext operatorContext)

        default java.util.Collection<OptimizationContext> getInnerInputOptimizationContext(InputSlot<?> innerInput,
                                                                                   OptimizationContext outerOptimizationContext)
        Retrieve those OptimizationContexts that represent the state when this instance is entered.
        Parameters:

        the inner OptimizationContexts

        Returns:
        the inner OptimizationContext
